Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lid; interior reserved; on vertical edge, brown (misfired) dots; exterior: brown band at perimeter; black-figure decoration consisting of lowered wing, with added red on upper part of wing and added white dots at base of feathers, of bird or siren facing right; at right, hind leg of feline moving right.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.783. A sherd in Boston (88.1078) with a horse’s head and siren comes from the same lid and probably joins 1888,0601.783 (Fairbanks 1928, pl. 37; ABV, 25, no. 11).
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.227, no.10)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 344, no. B422)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 147, note 43)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0825) (Phase 1)
Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.25)
